review: I love google and chrome, but the chromecast, just like the chromebooks, still has a way to go... there's no easy way to stream from your Mac (I used a browser plugin but it was impossible to watch a 2 minute video as it kept on stalling). review: Love my Chromecast! It is incredibly easy to set up and use. I love the fact that I can stream from my phone and still be able to use it to do other things at the same time. The price is also nice! Unfortunately, my sad little netbook cannot handle streaming videos from my Chrome tabs, but I have friends who were able to do it via a Mac. Also unfortunate is that it does not support Amazon Prime streaming. The consequences of competition, I suppose...I recommended this to another one of my friends, and he immediately bought three, one for each of his TVs!

review: I love shiny new gadgets and ordered this when I first heard about it. Setup was fantastic, just connect to your wifi / go to a URL and it is done.My experience has been fairly meh so far. I rarely find myself using Chromecast, either its capabilities haven't been marketed well enough or I haven't spent enough time trying to learn what all it can do. For now, it stays plugged in even though I don't use it.Pros- Easy setup- Easy to project youtube videos onto TV from your phoneCons- I bought this thinking I would be able to share pics from my phone (Android) to TV but I don't think I have found a good solution for this. Can't project anything from your personally photo / video library on to the TV using Chromecast. Atleast I haven't figured this out just yet.- Limited functionality - I already have an Apple TV and through that I can project my entire Mac onto the TV screen. This gives the ability to play any content through your chrome browsers but that's about it. I really can't think of any wow/extra features which makes this exceptional.
